comments.text: Great spot to the north, all traffic comes pretty slow.
Good Spot, got a Ride to Ivalo relatively fast. Sign higly recommended.
Best spot to head north from Rovaniemi. Bus #8 comes here from the city and train station. Got a ride to Ivalo after 15min wait.
Extremely high traffic, lot of cars drive slowly to the north. Lot of space for car to stop on nearest bus stop.
Really bad luck here (3h) but two other groups came and went while I was waiting. They waited ~45m each.
Great spot, stood with sign and got a direct ride pretty quick.
Best place to hitchhike Jyvaskyla direction. Winter snow day waited for less than half hour got direct ride
Hitchiked to Jyväskylä on a friday afternoon and it took me less than 5 minutes to catch a ride.

I would suggest it also as a first spot, take the bus 28 from Keskustori, get off at bus stop Vastarannankatu, and walk about 2 km, because it is very worthy, I got a ride from a russian truck straight to Jyväskylä and farther to Pieksämäki in only a few minutes!
First time hitchhiking. Got ride in about 20 minutes.
Bus stop after the roundabout. Best spot to head south. Also possible to take a bus from the city close to here.
We got a ride straight to Helsinki in 15minutes at the bus stop.
Found a ride straight to Jyväskylä standing on the bus stop after the roundabout.
standing after the roundabout works also for hitching a ride north, as we found out. got a ride to Rovaniemi after a short wait.
Use the bus stop after the roundabout. First place to hitchhike after the highway.
Great spot to hitchhike Kuopio direction. Almost immediately got the ride even snow winter day
I went to the first bus stop in direction of Kuopio. Just 50m from car park. 15min wait.
Finns from JKL have recommanded us that spot too. It's really an excellent one, with plenty of space and trafic.
To Kuopio and Mikkeli. Very good point. You can take bus from centrum to get (only) near this spot.
Great visibility and nice bus stop, I had awesome ride with Latvian truck driver.
Good spot, drivers see you from far away. No cover from the rain though. We were 2 guys, waited 45 minutes here and got a ride to Inari.
Great spot to go north.
Perfect spot to continue north. Bus stop with slow speeds. First car stopped for me.
Great spot
For Helsinki / Turku. Traffic drives slow here. You an also try at the gas station.
We waited at the bus stop nearby because there was a construction, cars go slow, perfect for direction Jamsa.
Bus stop with a lot of space for cars to stop. Got a ride to Vääksy.
We were lucky, the first car stopped and took us to Tampere.

This is the place to get off for connection on E75. Works north towards Rovaniemi, south towards Oulu and east towards Tornio and Sweden. Please notice that the road from Tornio to border of Kemi and Simo municipalities is motorway where hitchhiking is neither allowed practical as cars go 120kph.
Good spot for the South get out here or walk back to here if your driver goes to some other directions and there's a lot of space for the cars here to stop :)
Really great spot, however wouldn't recommend taking shorter rides so wait for one that goes +100km

For a rather central Helsinki this is the only good spot for going outside, lots of cars with low speeds as they need to turn, nice area for cars to stop, always got a ride within 30 minutes, try to catch cars coming from ferries
Got a ride to Vaasa after just two minutes, really nice spot!
With sign "Turku". Got a ride to Turku, and was offered a place to sleep there aswell.

Great spot, a lot of Finns coming back from Sweden with snuff. Cars go cca 30kmh, plenty of time to decide if they wanna take you. Got a ride to Rovaniemi Santa Claus village in 30 minutes, dont forget to change your clock one hour forward once you arrive in Finland :)

! Have a sign ! 
Just after the border. Perfect spot for Rovaniemi / Oulu / North / etc. Slow speeds, plenty of traffic and tons of space for the cars to pull up.
Bus stop. Hitch E from here (or get a lift to Visulahti at least).
Bus stop. Hitch S towards Ristiina / Kouvola from here.
coming from the ferry, use a sign with Mariehamn if you want to go to the main "city" of Aland
Also gas station nearby for coffee and wifi. ;)
Any side at the roundabout is a good position to continue trip.
Radantaus P bus stop. Got lift to Iisalmi from here.

Low car speed (50), bus stop. We would have gotten a ride to Oulu centre in 10min (but since we were going further south we wanted a ride to oulu where we could get 25km past Oulu to the big traffic circle). Got that kind of ride 20min later.
Not such a good spot to north! Asked people to get a ride and most of them went to South. Got a ride close to Kemi (where we got stuck because the stops there aren't great)

Big traffic and lots of cars around here 
The Best spot to the South I've got picked up untill Lahti :D

6min and we got a ride to Oulu. Low traffic and a bus stop. We came from Tampere and got a ride to Jyväskylä, but stopped already here 25km before Jyväskylä to get a good place to continue our journey to Rovaniemi.  (If your going to Rovaniemi and you get a ride from this spot to Oulu, I would recommend getting out 25km before Oulu at the large traffic circle and stay there until you get a direct ride to Rovaniemi)
There are always nice bus stops on the road. Used this one to kuopio. So go on the road (if it's no highway) and use your thumb. It works better than cardboard. And don't wait on rest places
Here you can find a lift to Visulahti
You can find easily lifts to Helsinki from here

less than a minute straight to H-ki. alone. ue a sign. and ppl who return from vacation give you a good suppot with smiles and stuff like that.

P.S on the ferry was going with a sign "Going to HEL(L)?" people liked mostly but no one helped.haha. changed to helsinki and on this spot found a ride

Place to catch a car from Viking Line to Helinki.

if you didnt succeed to find a driver on the ferry,when they open the gangway-RUN all the way down to this place and you'll catch the cars leaving the ferry.it turns out there are plenty of drivers who take cabins to get some sleep even if its the day ferry.
P.S the gangway is situated ino the "viking cruises" building on the left. if you took the wrong road and stucked in front of the railway-just jump over it-it's not functioning!
Tried many times, direction Godby.
If you travel by first morning ferry ship you should ask somebody for a ride on ship. I was taken by last car.
Asking on the ferry from Hummelvik got me a ride directly to Turku quite easily.
I waited in the bus stop opposite the church, right in the town centre. I had to wait no more than 1 minute to get a lift towards Rääkkylä.
A very quiet road, but nevertheless a good spot at least for a female hitcher. I had to wait on Tuesday noon for about 2 minutes towards Liperi direction.
We were to with a "Jyväskylä" sign, direct ride after 10min

Towards Helsinki. Most of the cars going to Helsinki from Kouvola should pass this place. A lot of space for cars to stop and good visibility but cars usually drive at high speed. Also good visibility for drivers, that enter the road from the cafe across the road and they drive slow enough to spot you. You can also try asking drivers at the parking space near that cafe across the road.

If you arrive via e.g. Ryanair and want to go to Helsinki direction, it's a nice point. Many people arrive from other cities to pick up/drop their friends to/from the airport. Asking drivers for a ride works really good here.
Bus stop. Heading to Lempaala I got a ride very easily.
Bus stop, direction Turku. Very good spot!
Asking on the ferry got me a ride quite easily to Hummelvik (harbour for the next ferry to Kumlinge and Brando)
Bus stop right after the bridge. I got a ride to Prasto (ferry to Vardo) on my way to Kumlinge.
Bus stop, in front of a gas station and minimarket. I got a ride to Mariehamn quite easily.
Bus stop. I was heading to Eckero, but I got a ride only to Hammarland quite soon.
I found a ride to Mariehamn quite easily asking to people on the ship from Galtby (Turku Archipelago).
Bus stop. If you're heading further on the Archipelago or Aland this is a good spot.
Bus stop. If you're heading further on the Archipelago islands or to Aland islands this is a good spot.
Bus stop, very good spot in direction Tampere, cars goes quite slow because of speed limits, full traffic and huge space to pull over.
Bus stop in a perfect spot to reach Jyväskylä, lots of traffic, slow cars.

Not very useful but I write it down just for fun. I was walking in this tiny country road coming back from a little festival and the first car I met stopped and I got a ride straight to Lahti by a guy who didn't even know there was a festival in the neighbourhood!
Bus stop. Quite good spot for hitchhike to Sysmä.
Lot of place for cars to stop. Found a ride to Eura quite easily.
Bus stop after the turn. Very good spot to find rides to Vesilahti.
First spot after the motorway. Found a direct ride to Tampere very easily.
Bus stop next to Sepän Kievari -café, where everything's expensive. Towards Mikkeli and beyond.
Towards Varkaus (Mikkeli/Helsinki and Jyväskylä/Tampere). Bus stop near by junction. Because of crossing cars are going slow, and that is why this is really good spot to hitch-hike.
I was standing somewhere here on this road and I've got picked up in like 5mins to Kemi :)
Bus stop right before motorway ramp. To Hämeenlinna. Use sign.
Bus stop, to Raahe and Oulu.
Bus stop to Lahti and Helsinki. Lots of space to stop. Slow speedlimits. Use sign.
Awesome visibility for going north (Vaasa), a very big place for cars to stop. Some kind of gas station and shop very close.
Good place to hitchhike short distance in every direction. Stay on the main roads, avoid town centers, better to wait at bus stops on the road where there is enough space for cars to stop.
Countryside with many small towns around. Great to hitchhike short distance.

Bus stop. You can take a bus 32 or 61 from the city to here.
Good place to go towards Kajaani.

Bus stop.
Ok place to go towards Kajaani

Eastwards. 
Bus stop in front of the grocery store.
This is a good place going to the direction of Oulu
Got dropped off here on way to Helsinki and got another ride within a minute!
Hitched from bus stop in front of Hesburger.  Good spot to get a ride to any place along road #8(Rauma, Pori, Vaasa).
Two people waited less than five minutes to hitch-hiking to Godby
Parking north of the marina.
Two people waited less than five minutes to hitch-hiking to Godby.
Road near bridge.
I chose this spot, there was enough space for the cars to pull over even after the bus stop. I waited 70 minutes which is very good in Oulu.

This is probably the best spot to take a lift out of Oulu. There is a bus stop just after traffic lights. The bus stop was in summer 2010 without bus connection so no public transport will rush you there. It's good to take also short lifts and to get to the cross of E75 and E8 in the south where is really great spot to catch a long-distance car towards Helsinky.
To Kouvola. At the bus stop.
Motorway Services, best option to reach to try to reach Helsinki
To the South, bus stop
From Liminka to Oulu and the North. Bus stop.

A gasstation, from where I went north. Possibly you could also go south from here.
I was standing with a sign and two guys came directly to talk to me and offered me a ride in about 10 minutes.
Great spot for the Tampere direction. A lot of cars going from nearby gas station, a lot of space to stop and slow cars.

Not a bad spot for the ride south. However, I made a mistake and trusted my previous driver, who dropped me off here. I needed to go north, not south. But this guy brought me to a nice spot, where I could turn around.
Absolutely amazing spot, there is an even better one just after the roundabout though. Plenty of cars are going slowly in your direction.
Plenty of cars go to Porvoo. I hitched a boat to this place, and I had no trouble getting from here. You can be seen clearly, and there are plenty of locals and tourists going from the archipelago.
Good visibility for cars, got a ride quickly. (2 of us, northwards)
I was hitching with 2 friends, and we got Quick ride to neighbor city ivalo
Best spot outbound to Turku, plenty space to see you, plenty space to stop. Our wait was long due to hitchhiking at late evening.
Legal and safe spot to hitch out from Jyväskylä towards Tampere.
Got a ride to Kajaani from the second car that saw us. Great spot
Bus stop close to Soiva Metsä. Got a ride easily
Mid length walk from Mynämäki. Has a lot of forest close to camp in.
Good bus stop for going south. Got a ride to Tampere
Awesome spot to go north to Norway. Cars go pretty slow because it is in town and there’s a good amount of traffic.
Great spot for Ivalo direction.

When it was hard to get to here, the swedes in the villages are likely to stop by and ask where are u headed (even if they are going the different direction) -completely different vibe to few kilometers more south, seems like a nice small community around here, got stopped thrice within 20 minutes for getting a car towards Jeppo
Very nice bus stop and wide shoulder for going to the islands, decent amount of cars with very slow speeds, wait time of 5-10 minutes
Towards Rauma, nice wide area for cars to stop, speeds are slow, wait times of 5-20 minutes
Towards Tammisaari (Ekenäs), very nice view for cars coming on highway, long speeding lane, perfect spot with wait times of 5-15 minutes
Would recommend using a sign here, got a ride to Helsinki within 5-10 minutes, great spot relatively close to Lohja center

Towards Salo, this is the area where the national park ends and most cars take this road to go back to Salo or further, slower speeds and touristy area which makes easier for cars to pick you up. Wait time of 5-15 minutes
Perfect spot for going towards west direction, there's street lights for the darker times, wide and not that much used road so cars are likely to pick you up, got a car within 5 minutes
Bus stop towards north direction, slow speeds, very good spot, wait time of 5 minutes
Towards Vihti, traffic lights make the traffic slow, wide bus stop and lots of cars, wait time of 10-20 minutes

There is a bus stop.
Got a lift to Sodankyla just 10 mins after even though it was around 6pm at winter

There is a bus stop here.
Good spot.

Good spot. If you are heading down, there is a gas station across. If you are heading north, there is a bus stop. 
Got a lift to Kemijarvi by 3 minutes
Low traffic in winter, a few cars per hour I would say. I am lucky someone stopped at the gas station and could bring me to Vuotso.
Tried hitch hiking in winter. It worked. After waiting 30 minutes and about 10 cars passing me, someone brought me to Ivalo
The third car picked me up to drop me to Kemi
Easy to get back to Rovaniemi
People going out of work. Find a guy to go north of Oulu. Lot of locals but worked for me
Middle of nowhere but there is a bus stop and find a ride to Jyvaskyla
With a sign, you can have car which enter the highway and the car on the highway
There is a bus stop and some traffic
Plenty of space for cars to stop. Grocery store and Alko nearby. Got a short ride to Kuusamo very quickly.
We were on the way north to Oulu. The first person we asked offered to take us 300km most of the way there to Kempele.
Got a ride to Espoo as soon as we lifted the sign and a thumb. Really good spot in our experience.
Low speed limit and very good visibility.

Bus stop with slow speeds. Perfect place to head south. Most cars will drive to at least Rovaniemi, as there isn't too many villages before that. Gas station next door and some decent woods to camp in 1km south of here.
Perfect spot here to head south. Really wide spot for cars to stop for you.
Bus stop. Clear view for the cars.
The road is under construction so the exact spot might change but now the speeds were very slow and I got a ride even before I started hitchhiking since my sign was visible. Going north.
Bus stop on the 8
Got a ride to Rauma in less than 5 minutes.  Lots of traffic and plenty of space to stop. The traffic is already sorted out so a really good spot if you want to go to Rauma or Turku
Nice Busstop, not alot of traffic, got picked up immediatly. Going south to Jyväskylä
Good flow of traffic, cars are going slow and have a good space to stop, theres a gasstation closeby :) Ride for 200km south.
I sleeped here in this bus station, than i walked towards Karasjok. Great town, great view! Nobody bothers me.
Good spot but lower traffic in direction to Helsinki.
Good spot as there is a high traffic and also cars drive slowly because of speed radar after the bus stop.
Better spot than the gas station if you want to get more to the south in direction to the Jyvaskyla.
Very good spot to the South or Sweden, low traffic but lof of cars, caravans driving from holiday back to the south.
Good spot but very low traffic in the late evening. More trucks drove in there rather than cars.
Even in the late evening it's possible to get a ride to the south. People are friendly and helpful.
In the morning very low traffic but easy to get a ride to Ivalo.
Good spot to get to Kajaani.
Low traffic in the morning, but we got a ride at least nearby the main road to Kajaani.
Good spot but lower traffic in the evening, however we got a ride to Vuokatti. In the evening drove 3 cars in 30 minutes during summer.
It's better to hitchhike from the bus stop as less people drive to the gas station nearby.
Good spot to get a ride to the North.
Even we got a ride just for few kilometres, but we got out of the city.
Big gas station, lot of cars and trucks, but lot of cars were full or drove to their summer cottage. However it's possible to get a ride to Kuopio.
Lot of cars ride to the north, big chance to get a ride to Jyvaskyla.
Great spot with a lot of space to get a ride in direction to Mikkeli.
First car stopped and took us to Kannuskoski.Low traffic.
Not the worst spot, but very low traffic to get a ride in direction to Kouvola.
Great spot with a lot of space to Lappeenranta. High traffic.
Nice spot to hitchhike, good bus stop place for safe stopping, but could be more local cars then at the end of Hamina.

You should stay before trafficlight at the right side of road and ask drivers for ride to Himina or farther. 
I guess this is the only place where you can hitchhike.
Good for getting a ride to Helsinki. Cars get to see you when they stop at the traffic lights and there's plenty of space for them to pick you up.
Great spot to Kuopio from here even the direct eventually drive to Helsinki! This in January winter hitchhiking
Great spot to Joensuu after the ride from Kuopio to here. Didn't wait long even January winter

Great spot to Joensuu from here as only direct main road. Found direct to Riistavesi 
Winter January hitchhiking still good
Great spot to Helsinki from here and very lucky to get ride within 5 mins directly to Helsinki even January winter -10°c
Its not as bad spot as it is said to be. Cars have some space to stop and there are enough traffic but a sign can be useful.
A great one, a guy got me to Pihtipudas. Large bus station, cars going slowly and north. There is a gas station nearby if you need something.
Very good spot, a lot of cars stopping on this abc
Got a lucky ride to Lapland after an hour, good spot, large gas station to rest and charge if hitching is slow too.
Not so much traffics but find a ride straight to Oulu
Not great conditions, but trafic is low enough si people will stop. And it's not like there is any other options nearby. Got a ride to sweden in 5 min.
Very good spot towards Tornio, wait time of 5 minutes, seems like this junction can be used for any direction with a really good success rate
Some traffics and space to stop. Straight to Rovaniemi
Doesn't seem like popular spot for HH, but some crazy girl stopped, she asked me if I'm gonna kill her, and then took me to next ABC which was better spot.
Good spot
On the way north, waited with an Oulu sign. Got a short-ish ride to ABC Kirvaskangas relatively quickly. Not a perfect spot for cars to stop, but good enough. Walkable from the city center.
This place worked well. 5 minutes and got a cat.
I used a sign "short ride is enough" just to get past the highway part of the big road.
I would say one of the best spots on the way to Rovaniemi. Basically, all the cars going to Rovaniemi go on this road, and because it is rural, I believe they are much more willing to stop.
Great spot for Rovaniemi, this is the only road there pretty much, so someone will stop :)
Decent spot for catching a ride south
Best spot in Kuopio if you want to catch a ride to south.

Many cars, but mostly go to Kittila.
Great view and lots of space for cars
Perfect spot to head south. Many rides only might go to Kittilä, if so, try to get to the Neste gas station in the southern part of the town to get to good spot and minimize walking.
There are a lot of traffics. With the traffic light you can show your sign for one side at the other. Find a ride to turku on the morning

We got two cars. One wanted to get paid, the other one was really kind and gave us options, where it could be better. In the end He took us to Muijala bus station. This (the bus stop in Muijala) is not a bad spot, but the traffic is low in the evening so after going Down the highway, we gave up and went to the bus station Back. From here it goes at least every Hour like 16.30,17.30,.. For like 19 e/person. Maybe it is more frequented in the morning.
Maybe i suggest staying here a little longer
Not easy to get out of Helsinki but doable.
Yup, good spot. Ride to Lahti in 20mins. Sign highly recommended.

Got a lift til Lahti in 60mins, and several offers to get taken to the highway. 
I stood just _before_ the traffic lights, which was recommend to me by a local passing by. (maybe that's good because drivers don't accelerate yet, don't have to stop at the bus station (where indeed many busses stop), and still have enough time to pull over into the empty space next to the street (which at this point is still within in city limits so no need to worry about "stopping on the highway") idk.)
Agree with all of the comments above, only downside are the buses stopping here (like every 5 minutes), then cars cannot see you…
High traffic, but it was difficult to find someone who drives in direction to Porvoo because it's still nearby city center.
best spot to leave Tampere.
Bus stop. Long waiting time but eventually got a ride to Helsinki(Espoo). Put a sign that says Helsinki
Exquisite spot for going south, got a ride in 10 min
Good spot, but cars are driving fast and also there was a lot of buses so sometimes there wasn't space for car to stop.
I took me some time, but I still think is one good spot.
I managed to get really long ride from there. My rider was from Pudasjarvi, so I changed my route to Rovaniemi, it worked.
The Viitasaari ABC. Ask people for rides or have a sign. Works for both north and south.
great spot for direction Turku and Helsinki. i found a ride to Turku city centre. i reccomend using a sign
Got a ride to Turku in 30 minutes (07.2014).
Gas station, traffic going both directions. Have a sign.
Exquisite spot. Got a ride before I could finish eating my banana

Place was all good, lots of traffic. Side note: first time in Finland someone who said his nasty thoughts out loud gave me lift from this point. He gave his propose right before where promised to leave. I refused and he left me out safe.

Bus stop.
Towards Iisalmi and Kokkola.
Great spot
Kajaani Th L bus stop in direction Oulu. Quite a busy road. Got a (local) lift.

I was here already in dark, not the best visibility and got quite some middle fingers, however got a ride also within 20-30 minutes, so I'd say this is indeed a really good spot for going north, definitely the best on this road
Great bus stop for getting out of Vaasa and to continue north on the E8.
Indeed a very good spot for going towards Inkoo or Lohja, nice crossroad and wide bus stop (which is plowed well at winter too), wait time of 5-10 minutes

Good spot, with decent amount of traffic. Rather more likely to get a ride to Inkoo rather than all the way to the Capital Area. Our waiting time was probably affected by the number of us - 3 hitchhikers. (07.2014)
Direction Helsinki, alternative to the highway.
Space for car to stop and some traffics, you need to go up a small hill to arrive there but really good stop for Jyvaskyla
nice spot!

To JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤.

Take a buss from center and drop out at the stop of citymarket/prisma right after going over JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤-road. Then walk upperhill over the onramps. You can ask from driver or other passangers. After a road fence there is just enough space for cars to stop. It's not super good place, but gives me always a ride in half an hour.
Two girls, got a ride really fast to the Vaajakoski ABC with a sign "ABC". Good spot because of the traffic lights.

It is a bus stop and there are traffic lights before it so the cars are driving slowly and it is easy to see you. I have hitchhiked from this place to lahti and helsinki many times. You will probably catch a ride to Vaajakoski/ABC and there is a good place to continue.
To Kuopio, Mikkeli and Lahti. First you should take ride to the ABC in Vaajakoski. You can use sign "ABC" (people will understand). From ABC it's very easy to continue both (Lahti/Kuopio) directions.
Got a rode to Helsinki instantly :) Good flow of traffic alot of space for cars to stop, 24/7 open Gasstation with nice toilets closeby.
A bus stop just before the roundabout a good place to hitchhike to Lahti or Helsinki.
A great spot north. A lot of cars, a kinda spacious place to stop, everybody is going north.
got a ride to Viitasaari in 20 mins. standing on the bus stop works really well. slow traffic, drivers will be able to have a good look of you and your sign.
The Palokka ABC. A good spot for hitching north. Oulu, Rovaniemi etc. Stand on the bus stop before the highway ramp or ask people for a ride.
Great spot, slow speeds with a bus stop.
Easy ride to the north, especially to the Norway. We got ride to Karigasniemi.
We have tried to catch a car to Oulu Sunday noon. There was a few cars and enough place for them to stop.
I was unlucky and not so many cars going far on saturday but still probably the best spot here towards south.
Maybe I got lucky but I got a ride pretty quickly here. Seemed like the best spot in the area to head south. Just enough space for people to stop after the circle.
Spot is good, but not much traffic and got lucky that finally someone stopped. Summer/Sunday
Ok, but low traffic
Quite low traffic but otherwise a great spot to head south.
Good spot to the south, but very low traffic in the late evening.
Very good spot when heading north, I hitchhiked with the sign Jyväskylä
Waited with a Jyväskylä sign. A taxi driver took us to a different bus stop a little further out from where we soon got a ride to Jyväskylä.
A good spot with a lot of car and a bus station, we were 2 waiting with a "Jyväskylä" sign, no car stopped. It was monday at 8am so it might be the reason

Near university of applied sciences (TAMK). To Lahti and JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤. There is a good bus-stop where you can hitchhike ("Kissanmaa"). You can walk here from city center. You can take a car going to wrong city, but remember to jump out before motorways. Using sign isn't necessary. Wating times: 5-40min.
There is almost no traffic. I took 10min to see first car in this place, they stopped for me and took to Karigasniemi
Very few cars but otherwise a great spot. Also people are more prone to pick you up this middle of nowhere.

Nice environment. (2022) There is a beautiful river. There is not a single village towards Karasjok. So if you can, at least go to Karasjok! 
If you go into the forest you can eat wild blueberries. Forest soil is very interesting! It's shallow.There were a lot of mosquitoes. I didn't pay for accommodation, but I could take a shower in Inari for 5 euros!
Very good spot towards Karasjok, Norway, cars go very slow on the turn, so they can see you well, there is plenty of space to stop. Two guys we waited here for 20 minutes.
Walked there from Kamppi. In just under an hour we got a ride all the way to Tampere.

A lot of local traffic, but still the best bet for Tampere direction. If travelling light, even walkable (about 1h from downtown Helsinki), also blackriding the tram 10 is easy. If you get a short ride, be sure to get out at a petrol station (eg. Keimolanportti about 20 km away) rather than motorway junctions, which most are pretty quiet.
Waited 20 minutes to get a ride with people driving to Tampere
Maybe it was just bad day today, waited +1h with Hämeenlinna sign. But still the best spot to get out of Helsinki to Hämeenlinna and Tampere.
Wait a few meters before the bus stop, sign is a must. Really good place to hh.
Took some time, but found a ride all the way to Helsinki.
Good spot on the crossroad. Cars can go quite fast but there is good visibility, so with sign it is great.
Cars going a bit fast, but otherwise a good spot. Got a ride in 20 minutes
Cars are going pretty fast and doesn't seems to be used to hitchhikers
Good visibility and high traffic, kind of hard to get a ride.

As of March 2025 the spot seemed quite bad, little room for cars to stop, badly plowed bus stop, as well as wait time of 100 or so minutes before a local gave me a ride to " a better" spot, I'd honestly go with a bus a stop further and walk out of Ii for a ride north
Great stop but it was dark

Great spot to get more to the north. There is a high traffic and only one main road. Lot of cars from Sweden. We got a ride in less than 5 minutes all the way to Rovaniemi. Cars were driving slowly as there was a speed radar.

Early bird caught an enormous worm, got a ride not to Tornio or Haparanda but to GÄVLE 2 hours north of STOCKHOLM. Traffic lights just before this bus stop and a Shell gas station aswell. There is a bus from Oulu that stops at this bus station, highly recommend. A local suggested skipping Kemi and taking a ride all the way to Tornio, because many travel to Ikea Haparanda with an empty car and Kemi is nit very friendly for hitchhiking.
A bus stop with a lot of cars going to Kemi, and some trucks in the shell station
I've always got a ride from here to Helsinki in 10 minutes, lots of traffic. Use a sign!

Took me quite long to get a ride to Helsinki from here even though there were hundreds of cars passing the spot all the time. Too busy and little results, can't really recommend this place.
I tried walking onwards down the road but there didn't seem to be any better spots nearby.
Drivers have sometimes difficulties to stop here, cuz it comes just after huge cross road. I'm nowadays just walking 'till the next bus stop where visibility is much better.
This is an OK spot and quite popular if you want to go to Helsinki. Waiting times can vary a lot! There also can be a lengthy line after festivals or other big happenings.

Been here two times trying to get to Turku. First time got a ride to Toijala after waiting for 15 minutes, next time to Forssa after waiting for 3 hours. I guess it's easier to get to Helsinki or Hämeenlinna from here.
a man approached me and offered a ride straight to Tampere. i just got lucky because there was almost zero traffic on a Saturday afternoon.
Stood with Tampere sign, cars come slow out the station and rather good amount of traffic
Found ride from the person in petrol station to Hameenlinna. Definitely good spot to hitchhike even snow winter day
I've done this by showing the sign in the end of the petrol station
Petrol station complex Neste Keimolanportti itä situated in the suburb of Vantaa. You can easily arrive there from Helsinki by bus. The name of the bus station next to the petrol station is Keimola.
Decent spot, but not a great place for cars to stop. Got a ride surprisingly fast, though

Good spot to get a ride to Helsinki as there is high traffic, but not a lot of space for car to stop. However we didn't wait too long and one car wanted to stop but continues to drive and then came back for us in 10 minutes. So it's better to stay closer to the crossroad as cars have much more time to see you and then stop the car where there is still a space.
Towards Helsinki - the best spot, cars coming from 3 directions, they stop at the traffic lights and have enough time to think about picking you up.
Managed to get a ride to Hämeenlinna that goes through Tampere. A lot of cars.
We managed to get a ride from a taxi driver (!) on febuary in 30mn, but there's indeed not a lot of space. Decent spot but still looking for a better one.
Not allowed for pedestrians but a good place after traffic lights. Not a lot of space indeed but got a ride from a big truck in Lahti direction.
towars Keuruu and Turku:hitchhike after the traffic lights.
got a ride to a place 30km from Tampere direction Jyväskylä. I used a "TRE" sign.
Bus stop name is Prykinkuja and you can reach here with bus 21 and 23. Heading to Tampere, I once got a ride to Aura quite easily and once got a direct lift to Tampere after 1 h. Use a sign!

This spot is a bit diffcult to reach but once there trying to get a lift to Tampere I wasn't able to get a direct ride but I waited maybe about 20 minutes to get a lift to a petrol station maybe 20 kilometres ahead and from there I got a lift to Tampere.

Good spot to go highway 9 direction Tampere. There are traffic lights so cars wait and see you. It's a bus stop so cars can stop there quite well and you can go there by bus but unfotunatly i don't know what the stop was called like and what lines go there. I guess line 21 or 231 or both of them go there.
A good spot towards north and south (Bus stops). I think I was very unlucky here, but also not much traffic towards north. A gas station has quite limited opening times.
Bus station where there is good visibility, near to a gas station (toilets and so on)
It is ok, and there is a gas station across if you head north. Just low traffic, especially if you head south
headed to Tromso. not many cars around, but I just started to chat with one guy on gas station, and despite the fact he wasn´t heading there, he took us to Kilpisjarvi. We was very lucky.
Good for getting to Tampere. Got a ride within 15 minutes waiting at the exit.
The ABC petrol station about 5km northwest of the city. You should find a ride to Tampere relatively easy.
Good spot for heading towards Kemi, enough space for cars to see you and stop.
Kuolaniemi E bus stop. Scenic view over lake behind you, but is quite a long walk from Rovaniemi (~40m walk from bus stop near Lidl).
There is no  bus stop here anymore.
Get a ride to Oulu after 1 hour of waiting, good spot to hitch
To Oulu. Stand on the bus stop. Traffic lights, good visibility and relatively low speed.
20 mins to Porvoo from the bus stand. It was my first time hitch hiking. Sign recommended since the road seperates into two quickly after the bus stop.
I don't know if i was lucky, but I had a ride to Piter from there in 10 minutes.
By far the best place to catch a ride to the east. Sometimes I only catch short rides until Porvoo, but beyond that it gets better.
Got a ride to Porvoo quite easily, driver was going to Helsinki. Good spot!
got a ride directly to helsinki after 5 minutes of waiting.
To all directions. Stand before the traffic lights and the McDonald's or at the beginning of the rightmost lane. Have a sign.
cars go really fast here, but short waiting time.
Got a ride to Helsinki after 15 Minutes while there was low traffic on a Sunday morning :)
Took us a while to get a ride to Helsinki, but we got one after being patient. Te traffic lights are a good place to position yourself. Cars can stop at the busstop after the crossing.

Technically this should be a good spot... But I stood there for 90 minutes without finding a ride and ended up taking a bus (23 line) to Ii, in the hopes of finding a ride from there. If your planning to go to Sweden from Oulu, I'd recommend going to Ii straight away (A-C zones). Don't waste your time.
Bus stops on either side of road. North to Mikkeli / Varkaus / Kuopio. South to Kouvola.
Good but maybe worth walking to next bus stop... got lift after 30min but the bus stop is also a slip road.
To north and south from Mikkeli: walk a few kilometers north to Visulahti. Hitch-hike from the crossroad of the Visulahti camping area, there are bus stops at both sides of the road.
Bus stop in direction of Suurlahti / Astuvansalmi. 4 people stopped. Very few with English.
Seems like a good spot, but I had to wait a long time (but thankfully got a lift the whole way to Oulu then).
Bus stop with lots of room for cars to stop. Good visibility along the 88 road. Traffic 1 car per minute.
Bus stop in Rovaniemi direction. Started hitching ~8am on Sunday morning. Lots of motorbikes, but maybe one car every 3 minutes. Waited only 30m.
You can't cross the border on foot. We asked about 30 drivers before found a ride. Queues may be very long.

Summer/ Dir South

Good spot to stand! next to the gas station by a bus stop. DONT stand in Mounio!
Got a ride quite easily to Helsinki on a sunny summer day. Nice spot close to the historical part of the town. Have a sign!
Good spot close to the city center. Direction motorway, cars likely going towards Helsinki.

Many cars in direction of Muonio and Sirkka but that could be due to the mid-summer holidays. Got to Muonio with one stop. Had to wait for less than an hour to get the first ride but got the second one till Muonio as soon as the first one dropped me.

waited 40min for a direct ride to Helsinki. 
got there by bus no. 3 direction Haapaniemi
after 30minutes i got a free taxi ride to the beginning of the highway (2km ride, but much better spot)
Was able to get a ride after 1 hr.  Good place right after the traffic lights, as cars are going slow.
There are several bus stops just after the red light, cars don´t go too fast and have time to see you and pull over
Stayed here for a few times with the "Kotka" sigh, easy to catch a car, but try to find a car which is leading exactly that direction you need
The bus stop is a bit behind a bush but it's a good place. Car #284 (at 1pm) picked me up for 150km ride to Mikkeli.
A bus stop near a junction where passing traffic is not moving too fast.
To Pieksämäki, Varkaus and Joensuu. There's a good bus stop where to hitchhike but you can also just go and ask for a ride from the at the gas station.
There is hard shoulder to pull over after the crossroads.

2 of us waited about 10-20minutes before getting a lift to Ranua (south).
A little bit tricky place to stop perhaps but we were visible to the traffic coming from all three directions.
We (2 females) waited max. 20 mins in the rain going north towards Kuusamo. A bus stop, and a gas station on the other side of the road.
OK spot. Got a ride here after 15 minutes.
The place is OK. Quite good visibility and some place to stop. I took me 45 minutes to get a ride tough (with a sign saying '20 km' and flowers)
There is a petrol station here, a lot of cars were going to Helsinki. Not so many were going north.
A bus stop, few cars but usually they'll go for a long ride
There a nice bus stop with a roof, a lot of people going to the north
Lot of cars stop at this light, it's easy to get to Tornio from here
Bus stop. Very good visiblity. All the people going nort or south or from Airport will be going trough this road. Got ride in 30min in very low traffic.
Bus stop, I got ride from trucker after fifteen minutes, lot's of cars passing in summer and during morning and afternoon worker rushes.
there is a bus stop here, a lot of people coming from the city and going to the highway
Good spot to go to Kouvola or lappeenranta, we spent only 5 minutes there
If you want to go to Lahti, this spot is good.
Bus stop right after the gast station. The best spot you can find here, heading North to Muonio, Kilpisjärvi and Norway.
Bus stop. Good spot direction Turku. Cars go slow because of works on the road (aug. 2013) and speed cameras.
Right after the turn, direction Turku. I got a ride to Urjala. Not a lot of space for cars to stop.

I waited for quite a while to get a ride towards south and Tampere. But there are lots of cars passing and practically everyone coming from Bothnia take this crossroads.
There is a small gas station on the side of the road that provides food and toilettes.
Here's a bus stop on Keuruuntie for hitchhiking west.
Right after the turn, enough space to pull over, direction Jyväskylä.
Bus stop right after the turn. Good spot, even for 3 "bad faces" hitchhiking under the rain on a hang-over mode sunday morning... you'll always find a nice old couple moved to pity... that's Finland!
Bus stop, direction South. Maybe not the best spot, but still quite good.
Bus stop, easy rides to Suonenjoki and farther to Kuopio.
Bus stop. Cars go a little fast but still quite easy. Got a ride to Vesilahti.
First bus stop after big traffic lights, lots of traffic. I got a ride to Hollola, but possibility of longer rides is high I think.
Bus stop right after speed detector so cars have to slow down. Found a ride straight to Lahti.
Very good spot.
First bus stop after road 8 exit and traffic lights. Found a ride to Eura easily.
Right after the roundabout, not a lot of space for cars to stop, but near bus station, S-market, kahvila etc... Found a direct ride towards Nokia.
Bus stop. Found a ride to Sastamala keskusta exit on road 12.
ABC gas station. Found a ride to Oulu asking in the toilet (!)
Bus stop. Found a ride to Kiiminki ABC gas station.
Bus stop. Easy to find rides to Pudasjärvi or Oulu
Easy to find rides going to Vesilahti on this road

Towards Kuopio and Varkaus. There is good spot to hitch-hike after traffic lights. It is easy to get drive farther from the city. Really near by the spot is shopping center, and that's why there is lots of cars going by.
A 24h Shell Petrol Station. Many cars, some trucks too stop.
To Rovaniemi. Stand on the bus stop after the roundabout. Petrol stations also nearby.
Good spot for Ivalo or longer directions from here :D

At the ABC Tupos, you have a place to stay 24/7. There are many trucks which wanted to take us immediately but they couldn't because we were 2 people. If you are only one, there isn't any problem. We then wanted to ask people who were just about to go to their car if they could take us with them and the first people already said yes.
To Ylivieska.
Extremely good visibility. Cars drive rather fast so use a (large) sign.
To HÃ¤meenlinna and Tampere. You can travel to this spot by bus. You should try from beginning of the HÃ¤meenlinnanvÃ¤ylÃ¤ (and end of Mannerheimintie) before this spot.
another option is to first hitch a ride to the big ABC station and then to Tampere. If you use signs, having one that says "ABC:lle" or "to ABC" is handy in Finland anyways
Direction Tampere. Stand after the traffic lights and use a sign.
I have asked people in the parking lot but they're cars were packed mostly but then i stood in this spot and it worked well.
Bus stop. Lots of traffic to Helsinki centrum. No need for sign.

From Raahe to Vihanti and Pulkkila direction. Bus stop right next to gas station. Using sign will help.

Most of the rides will go only small distances.
There is an okay place to hitch south (towards Kotka). Its a bus stop so there is place to stop for cars.
Good amount of traffic to Lahti direction. Good visibility, low car speed.
Good place to hitch a ride to Varkaus or Joensuu
This is the place to go to Oulu direction.
Spot is on a busstop near a gas station, see the Helsinki topic on how to get there. It is one of the best spots in Helsinki to get to Tampere
Good for Forssa. Stand near bus stop and use a sign.
Long curve. You have to find a safe place.
To Helsinki. Side of the road after the ABC-petrolstation. It's wide enough for cars to stop at and anyone that's stopped at petrolstation will come through here. I waited for 10 minutes.

Quite good, tho it's a little harder to go to Lahti than Kuopio, because you'll either lose some trafic if you go on the bus stop (or have to take the 644 road which may become a trap), or put yourself on a spot a bit further the roundabout, where cars have a bit less space.
To Lahti and Kotka. Bus-stop is good place to HH.

It is easy to get this spot by walking from center of the city. There is some space after bus-stop, but unfortunately cars go really fast. After all, if you don't want to get bus further, this is average spot to hitch-hiking.

It is known that Finland isn't the best country for hitchhiking but in our case we had to wait about 20 min to get a ride all the way to Kuopio. Nice spot with room for drivers to pull over. And there is a nice little park to have a rest or chillout.
There are 2 gas stations, and a bus stop next to the smaller one.
eastwards
A bus stop, where you can start hh'ing. There are a gas station and a grocery store too.
North- and westwards; On-ramp. It's easy to get a ride at least to Toivala, where #17 begins.
towards Joensuu: there's a bus stop about 300 meters from the motorway.
towards Kuopio: There's an on-ramp bus stop.
Towards Kuopio, Varkaus; Either hh'ing here or asking the drivers at the gas station on the other side of the highway.
To Tampere. This is one option if you are closer to this spot than centrum. Beginning of the rantavÃ¤ylÃ¤ is better anyway.

In these days there are enough car's in road 13 to hitchhike. Busstop is good point to continue journey towards Mikkeli. 

There is a Shell-gas station / restaurant near crossroad.
To PieksÃ¤mÃ¤ki. Hitchhike from a bus stop.
To Mikkeli and Varkaus. Many good spots (small road).

took 20min to get a car to Tampere-Center
| 2010 oct.
To Sodankyla. Bus stop. Gas station and shop nearby.
A bus stop, close to gas station where trucs stop. I always start here when headingg to south.
Not a bad spot, you can be seen clearly. Low car traffic the further north you go, but people are more willing to take you in my opinion. There is a gas station nearby, but mostly local traffic.

Same story as my previous spot. There are only a few cars on this road, but they usually travel long distances. You can hide under a gas station roof in case of rain, as I did. In case you need a place to sleep, there is an emergency Laavu (shelter) nearby. There is a large place to stop, and you can be seen clearly.

The deeper you go into Lapland, the fewer cars there are. This is not the greatest spot, but I think you can't get much better. You can be seen clearly, and there is a place to stop. But most of the cars go left, not north.
Not much traffic

Pretty area. Not many people driving - you can wait hours between cars if you're unlucky. Might as well walk. But if a car passes, chances are it's a local, and chances are they'll pick you up out of curiosity. Keep an eye out for wolverines :)
Towards Oulu. Better to use the bus stop, asking people at the gas station might work as well. The driver could've taken us to Sievi, but we hopped off at Pihtipudas. (2 of us)
Spot is good, but there is almost no traffic, 1h is fine at this place.
Easily get to the next ABC
I was lucky to catch something to next station, but I would not say that this is a great spot.
Bus stop everywhere on this road. You can hytchike everywhere if there is good visibilty.

Eazy ride to Inari- Monday morning. 

On this road it's always easy. Just stand at any bustop.
Probably better Spot than Next to crossroad, but there is a High speed of cars
Not the best visibility, but a lot of cars going south
There is a finnish customs.  30 km/h and a traffic Light so cars go slowly.

Male, Sunday evening in summer, going south to Sweden. Mostly local traffic, but this is a place where people pass from Norway/Finland driving down to Sweden. Also a gasstation and a store nearby. Didn't need to camp because an elderly couple took me late in the evening to Sweden, but I think there is plenty of opportunities to camp in the forest.
A good spot towards Pori.
Towards south, bus stop with good visibility
Great spot for Oulu. Pretty much everyone from here go there.
Great spot for north. Pretty slow speeds after the roundabout and plenty of room to see you and stop.
A bit quiet but otherwise great.
Use one of the bus stops inside the village as cars have to drive slower.
At evening time there are lights, good visibility for cars and by now most locals have turned to sideroads, direction Oulu, wait times of 20-30 minutes
Northbound direction, seems like a very poor bus stop to hitchhike, however I got a ride within 5 minutes, probably 20-30 minutes seems more likely
Towards north, good visibility, decent speeds, okay bus stop, wait times of 20-30 minutes
Pretty good bus stop towards Hanko, nice spot for cars to stop, also helped by the traffic light which keeps the speeds down, wait time of 20-30 minutes

Wait time of 20-40 minutes, not too many cars are using this entrance for Inkoo direction, but it's a really nice spot accessable with trains from Helsinki (to Masala or Jorvas depending on which line you take and walk here-- on side note, be careful of ticket inspections and don't take lines further than Kirkkonummi.

Probably not the best way, but alternative route taken by trailers, slow trucks etc to go towards north to Hämeenlinna, very nice for cars to stop, especially for the ones coming from Hyvinkää, wait time of 10-30 minutes

Not that commonly used road but people are likely to pick you up, most cars go at least to Nurmijärvi, during wintertime the road was quite snowy (the bus stop area wasn't plowed through) but the road itself is wide, wait time of 10-30 minutes
Pretty decent bus stop towards Vihti, lots of cars, speeds are not that fast cuz of the roundabout earlier, got a car within couple minutes, but would expect 10-20 minutes wait time otherwise

There is a bus stop here. If you head toward Levi or Kittila, this spot is better than just in front of Muonio, since there is basically no space for car to stop there.
There are lots of space here thanks to the bus stop.
Low traffic but car goes at 50kmh so you have time to show your sign
Really low traffic but find a car to Aura
Had to walk 30 minutes and then there are space to stop and some traffics to go to Helsinki
Not a lot of traffic but space to stop and gas station near by

Waited with "Kouvola" sign. About a fifth of the cars seemed to take the highway to the west (Kouvola/Mikkeli direction).
Cars can stop at the bus stop and possibly by the ramp onto the highway. Got a ride to Porvoo (through Kouvola) eventually.
Nice view from the road. I got dropped off at the ABC nearby so I had to walk a bit. Used both thumb and a sign saying "Hki" (short for Helsinki)
Room for cars to pull over is a little tight. However, there is a lot of traffic and we got a ride fairly quickly.

The cars go quite fast but they can see you from far away and there is plenty of room to pull over at the bus stop. We waited with a "Joensuu" sign and were later told that most of the people driving south here are going there. Comes down to peoples attitude towards hitchhikers.
Waited with "Kajaani" sign. The cars go quite fast but the drivers can see you from far away and they can pull over at the bus stop.
Waited with "Kemijärvi" sign in the morning. Most people seemed to just drive short distances. Cars go pretty slow though and we quickly got a ride to Ruka near Kuusamo.
Good spot to go to Turku. People here seem to be very friendly and stop easily.
Because of the speed bumps, cars have to go very slowly, and there is only one direction to go on the big street.
Waited in the doorway because of the rain and asked around. Relaxed people, lot of going to different directions. Got a ride to Kerava.
headed to Tromso. I think it´s good spot, also cars can stop, and many Norwegian people go to kilpis to buy cheap stuff. bigger problem is to get to Kilpisjarvi, than from there more northern.
near bus stop. roads quite empty. got a ride to muonio after 2 hours of waiting

The spot is a little outside of Vaasa, but you can reach it with a bus. I waited 20 minutes until a truck gave me a ride to pori, but it was early noon in a workday, so I think it will be faster at other times. The spot is right after a traffic light and the cars can see you from a distance, there is plenty of space even for a truck to stop for you
There wasnt alot of traffic and the cars are going quite fast, got a ride to Ivalo with a taxi, not really anything around ^^'

Bus stop next to the highway, there is also a gas station here. Speed limit increases from 60 to 100 km/h immediately after the bus stop, so choosing one or two bus stops earlier might be nicer for the cars to be slower (speed limit is 60 all throughout Kuivaniemi and there is a camera at one of the bus stops so cars actually go slowly) . But there is plenty of space to pull over, I got super lucky and after about 30 minutes a truck stopped for me and took me to Oulu. (Female, summer, daytime)
It could be better....(2022)
Here or at the second nearest gas station, direction Jamsa
Low traffic, cars drove to nearest villages so not that far away more to the Oulu.
As there is a low traffic you have to wait for someone to stop, there is a high chance to have first car to stop.
Not the best stop, but we got ride to the north.

Quiet big gas station with enough traffic, so you can get ride to all directions. 
I had a sign "Kotka" with me and caught car directly to.

Not really perfect spot, but cars going slowly there and it's possible to catch someone. 
At morning time drivers have not good review of you because of the sunshine.
Actually the bus stop is a bit more nort on this road. Close to the church
been here twice takes a while but people take you quite far

I tried hitchhiking here in winter. Couldn't get a ride, but found a place to sleep in the house of a local. My plan was to take the bus the next day (only 1 bus a day), but while I was waiting, I tried hitchhiking and found a ride to Ivalo.
When I was waiting for boarding in Charleroi (Brussels South), I started asking people if they could give me a ride. Somebody who was on the same flight as me drove me to Helsinki.
Somewhere on the beginning of this Road Keuruuntie 18/23 there's a bus stop after traffic lights. An ideal place to hitch west. However, I'm not sure if this dot is in correct position.

There's a large bus stop there, and some trafic lights not far away if I'm not mistaken. A nice spot where I could find a ride around midnight (!) in 2010 and around noon with a friend in 2011 quite quickly.
Not a bad spot, very high traffic but drivers ride around the city no long distance. However it's a good spot to get out of the city to the nearest gas station on main road to south.
Couldn't get a ride up the road, came here after several hours and got a ride in 20min.
Oh, and try the get a ride at least until the roundabout at the end of the highway.

Easiest place to hitch south of Oulu. There's little place to stop, but you'll catch cars coming from both west and east and the traffic lights slow them down a bit. Expect to wait 45-90min though. Officially you're not supposed to stand there, so if the police will ask you questions say that you walked thru the forest or didn't notice the signs.
Really no place to pull over, but found it to be better then the spot listed further west along Kainuuntie street at the bus stop.
Not much space for car to stop but even so I got ride to the nearest rest spot along the highway
Decent spot but doesn't seem to have too many cars heading north. Slow speeds though and has a service station next door.
Not too much room for cars to stop but a high amount of traffic. Got a ride here within 5 minutes
I don´t think you can get much better when going towards Kittilä. I hitchhiked just behind the crossroads, only to realise there is a better spot not far away.
Roadside, not a lot of space for cars to stop. We got a ride to Kolari in 15 min., but maybe we were too lucky...
Got a ride just 10 km down the road to a pretty good spot
Slower speeds but not too much space for the cars to stop. Still works fine. Got a long ride to Heinola after the car passed once and came back for me.
Cars drive slowly, easy to get a ride in direction to Jyvaskyla. However in the late evening we got someone who took us just few kilometres, so not a long distance.
One female, waited 10 minutes, only using thumb. About one car per minute.
A bus stop. 2 of us waited for about 1,5 hours in total to get a lift to Rovaniemi.
High traffic but lot of cars drove to nearby village or in direction to Helsinki, however we got a ride to Hamina.

Tried to get a ride towards Lappenranta direction from 12.30 pm to 5 pm on Tuesday. A lot of truck drivers to ask. But farest that people were driving to was Porvoo. Most of them were going to Helsinki. Got stuck here and had to return back to Helsinki.
To all directions. A petrol station. Asking people for rides works pretty well here.
Succeeded to get a right straight to Kokkola.  Traffic lights and turn before crossroads helps.
To Ylöjärvi, Parkano and Vaasa. You can get here by bus number 3. Cars stop at the traffic lights (and have enough time to think about picking you up) but they also drive rather fast so use a sign.
Nowadays you should directly ask that little cars which are going to border control.
Good spot for asking drivers directly. Raja Market.
Easy even without a lot of traffics
A safe spot to hitchhike on the bus stop on the ramp, plenty space to stop and the cars are moving slow. Used both sign and a thumb.

I am very surprised of the previous comments. The spot is safe as there is a beautiful bustop to pull over. It was cosy to wait there, I was on the onramp of the highway, I had a sign and an Electric vehicle took me.
I just take ride after 20 minutes, but I really know that I had a lot of fortune there.

Ppl were so shocked that they started to make pictures with me and they forgot what I was asking... This was on petrol station, near it is bus stop... nothing better just stupid behaviour, after 10 hours I started to say please to every car and one stopped...
WRONG SPOT ! the spot people talk about here is on the other side of the road.
Great spot if you go to south. Literally got a ride just after arrived
Best spot to go south of Rovaniemi

Best spot to catch all the traffic from Rovaniemi to the South. There's space to stop the car on the side of the road even though there is no bus stop. Cars are driving by slowly because there is a traffic light just before. An okay walking distance from the centre.
Good spot towards the north
Decent if you can get someone to drive you there, you might get a ride faster than me if you're not going all the way to Vaasa

Relatively silent gas station but got a ride with a sign and a thumb (Saying Helsinki on one side, Salo on the other one) after 10 minutes to Salo. The driver who took me to the gas station recommended to try to get to Salo for a straight ride to Helsinki.

If you end up near paimo like me (the first lift couldn't take me further) this Petrol station is quite a good spot to get further. There was not a lot of traffic when I was there, but it's near the highway and a lot of the cars are going to Helsinki. You just have to ask the drivers directly, I think just standing there with a sign would take quite long since it's not a very bis petrol station. I got lucky and the first person I asked took me to Helsinki :)
I General not the best spot, but if
This is a university parking lot... The vast majority of cars will be local to Joensuu and surrounding villages. But if you don't care too much where your going, then sure..
towards Kuopio, Varkaus, Helsinki.
Used this bus stop for about 50 minutes before walking further up the road, not that good of a spot, speeds are high and at winter the conditions were very poor in the bus stop
Bus stop to Oulu direction.

Towards Jyväskylä. Quite busy morning traffic, but most of the cars and virtually all the cars on the closer lane were heading to Helsinki. Important to have a clear sign visible to the cars on the further lane coming from ABC.

Probably a great spot if you want to go to helsinki (two cars stopped within one hour and offered to take me there, and many slowed down to read my sign that said "Jyväskylä" and shook their heads). 
no one stopped for jyväskylä, but the bus stop in the other direction is convenient for getting to stop'n go grill (see there for further comments).
If you hitchhike here, a sign is necessary. I tried for about 15 minutes, but preferred going to the highway entrance.
A bus stop, both the cars from the ABC petrolstation and from Lahti go through here. And the cars can you see you at the lights...
Heading to Joensuu (south) direction, me as female hitchhiker alone had to wait max. 30mins to get picked up.

A little bit difficult to get cars to stop as it is still in the city, but this is just a few minutes from the train/bus stations and easy to get to from the city by feet. Ttheres connection to the road no. 5 and quite a lot of traffic and a long bus stop slide for the cars to pull down. 
Heading north towards Iisalmi/Kajaani the two of us had to wait about 1 hour and a half to get picked up.
Bus stop no longer there
a bus stop, just after traffic lights and uphill, so you'll be well visible.
north towards sodankylä, ivalo, norway, etc
Waited quite a while with a "Kajaani" sign. Cars can stop at the bus stop. Except they mostly don't. Got a ride to the middle of nowhere 70km away though.
I forgot to mention. Of course direction Kajaani.
Half hour waiting. Have been driven just few miles ahead but helped.
Could only hitchhiked when the light was red because the traffic is too fast. From hitchwiki they used to be a bus stop but its gone. Might be better trying the other spots around.
Towards Helsinki, already on the highway.

Bus information is outdated. 50 doesn't exist any more, you have to take bus 23 now.

This is a good place to hitchhike towards Kemie and Rovaniemi, I got here a ride within 15 minutes to the turn towards Rovaniemi.

I would consider taking the bus no. 50 from Oulu to here if you want to hitch north. The ride costs ca. 10e and lasts 1 hour. From here (or other stops in the town of Ii) you are sure to catch a ride.
A bus stop. A shell petrol station also nearby. Many trucks stop there.
I hitchiked there direction Tampere staying on the bus stop in front of the gas station. Cars slow down and you get also the ones exiting from the gas station. I got a ride after 30-40 min.

Somebody picked me up in Turku and drove me to this place. From there maybe 45 min later I got a direct lift to Tampere.
Good luck, God bess you!
There are two gas stations an ABC and Shell. You can get a lift on highway 9 to Tampere or Turku. There is not too much traffic but still enough that there is allways somebody to ask for a lift.

We tried at the gas station entrance at least half an hour. Then we walked to this spot and caught a ride after 5 min. It has begun to get dark, both spots might work better earlier. The driver had already seen us at the gas station and take us to Oulu.
Bus stop with a roof. Enough space for cars to see you and stop. Took a while to get a ride south though, might have better luck asking truckers/people at the Shell station nearby.
Not an amazing spot, but idk if there is a better one to leave Rovaniemi. I took the first ride after 5min just for 10k, cuz the road get narrow and car go slower so u can hitchike at any bustop.
A lot of car, but its illegal for them to stop there
Lots of local traffic, but found a Finnish truck going to Kemi.
High traffic, but cars drove mainly to the Oulu or cities nearby, not to the south. If so, they were full in the car during summer.
Low traffic but could get a ride to Haparanda
Low traffic but work to go to Tornio
Not the worst spot, good traffic even in the late evening, however cars drive more fast.
Bus stop with a roof. Low traffic in the morning. Otherwise good spot. Slow speeds.
Terrible spot, all the cars going to Turku drive on the lane furthest from you. Try the spot further ahead on the highway instead. We took the bus to Turku
may be bus stop nearby will be better
Going toward Joeensu. I waited just after the red light, there is some space for a car to pull over on the side.

Bus stop on road to Kustavi (Osnäs --> Aland)

take bus 210 from city center to Raison Sairaala. 

check http://www.foli.fi/en for departure times.
busstop. direction Kustavi (Ösnas --> Aland)

Summer / Dirr Haparanda

Small bus stop by the gas station, not much traffic

There is just enough room for the cars to stop. We hitchhiked from here with a sign Pohjoiseen(to North) and got a ride a bit further quite soon. Not impossible place but many cars are just riding to Jyväskylä centrum.

To Tampere a good place to hitchhike early in the morning (later a lot of trafic). It is easy to get there, many buses from center stop there. A lot of space to stop (and a bus stop in the end). You should get a ride in an hour.
On a rainy day it was quite hard to get a ride, even with a sign (to Mikkeli). We were two female hitchhikers.
The spot seemed fairly okay, but even with a sign (to Mikkeli) people weren't too eager to stop on a rainy ray.
I was here in the wintertime going South on a weekend so very few cars the junction after is much better for more traffic :D
Very less traffic, we waited around 3 hours for 10 cars. But we got a direct lift to Kautokeino ;-) at least faster than the bus.
The bus stop, pretty easy to catch a car to the side of Helsinki, don't forget a paper
A very quiet road, but about the 5th car stopped after 20minutes or so, heading to Rääkkylä direction (south)

A bus stop next to the crossing. I
(A female hitchhiker alone) had to wait for about 5-10 minutes towards Joensuu direction.
I camped somewhere in this area, so I had to hitchhike from here the next morning. There is a bus stop, but cars are driving fast. I waited 1 hour.
Took about 15 minutes to get a lift North from here. Not too much room for cars to stop but otherwise an OK spot with good amount of traffic and quite easily accessible by bus to get started

not sure exactly where, but 10km from Kilpisjärvi, not far from the border there is a customs, so you can find some trucks going to Tromso, Not a lot of cars, but at least they're driving very slow in  this area.
A nice place for car to stop before the bridge. Few cars are going to the north
cars have space to stop and they go at low speed to the highway, but there is quite few people going north. I was waiting with a "Kemi" sign, nobody stopped
we were 2 waiting with a "oulu" and "kärsämäki" signs, I guy took us saying it was a dangerous place to wait and that police'll come...
We were 2, waiting with a "Tampere" sign, a guy took us saying that we won't get any lift here, he drove us to a bus station away from the center
We were 2 with a "Jyväskylä" sign, waiting for 1h, one guy took us saying it was dangerous to stay here
Tried to get ride to Helsinki for 15 min. But then the spot across the road worked perfectly.
Small petrol station, cafe and rest space. Ask drivers for ride. From my experience most of them go to Kouvola.
Bus stop, not the best visibility but cars don't go too fast. Direction Jyväskylä.
Bus stop, cars maybe a little bit fast but very good visibility. Ride to Pieksämäki or at least to the main road.

Entry of a gas station, lots of space to stop, but cars go quite fast. If you have the bad fortune of being stuck here, I got a ride to Tampere by a russian truck after less than 5 minutes, not so bad after all!
Slightly better place for hitchhike to Sysmä. Got a ride to Asikkala KK.
Bus stop right after the turn, gas station near, but cars run quite fast here. Found a direct ride to Tampere after a while.
Bus stop. Found a direct ride to Rauma.
After the roundabout, not a lot of space for cars to stop, found a ride but only for few km further.
Bus stop. Found ride to Road n°12 (Tampere-Rauma)
Bus stop, only found a ride for few km further but rides to Oulu are also possible
I only found a ride for 12 km further, but I think that rides directly to Oulu are quite easy
Local traffic here
an ABC service station. open 6am til midnight. some trucks and traffic between Oulu and Jyväskylä.
Ramp to the highway. You can ask for a ride to Liminka rondabout.
This the only road out from this village but there are some traffic usually :D
not many cars on a rainy autumn afternoon, but we still managed to find a ride to Kotka in relatively short time. Toilets and Coffee available.
East toward Kotka/Kouvola/St.Petersburg. There's a rest area with a small cafe/restaurant. Ask people for rides.
It's a bus stop before Raumo and is a good place to continue on E8. You are seen at a long distance and there is a hill infront of you so people see you from behind other cars also

Hi Everybody,
I'm looking to head north up to Lapland.
I wouldn't recommend this, but rather the busstop only about then metres before! It's much safer!
Right before the ramp to the motorway. You will have to stand behind the small fence and there is no specially safe place for cars to stop, but the place is still ok.
Towards Varkhaus, Mikkeli, Lahti or Helsinki. Actually this spot is nothing special, I was waiting aprox. 2 hours. Traffic is not dense, try to get to road 23 and you will be more succesful.
a bus stop.

get here with a bus from center of Tampere and walked about 20min from end bus stop.
got a car to Haamenlina.
There is a bus stop in the on-ramp, best location to try to get out of this area direction south
had good weather, so 2,5 hours waiting were not so bad. Not much cars here - and nothing to do either.
Most likely you'll get a ride to Karasjok, but it's also a possibility to hitch some tourists going to Nordkapp. Not busy place at all.
to Turku: bus stop. use a sign.
A bit far from  centrum, but if you end up to here, there is a good bus-stop where you can hitchhike from. And lights for cars. Directions: JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤ and Lahti.

To Tampere (north).
I waited about 15 minutes, but the place is maybe not the best, because there isn't a very good stopping area.
However with a sign it worked out.
Same story as my spot, just further south. Fast cars, but quite a lot of them, and a large place to stop.
This spot was great for me, although I think I was just lucky. A car just across from the spot waved at me and got me to Jyväskylä.
25 minutes to get a ride to Niittylahti

Trucks driving past with a high speed, cops asked us to move appr. 20m farther from the spot right after the curve. 
Busy traffic but not that practical spot. At first the driver who took us wanted to take us just to a better spot, but ended up giving more than 50km ride and bought us snacks.
(2 of us)
I was just trying to get home, since I missed the bus haha. Success.
There were 3 of us, and we got a ride after 2 hours straight to rovaniemi

Here you have a bus stop with a roof if needed
You also have a K-market
But so it's sad cause half of the cars stops at this supermarket
I waited for a long time, this road is not easy to hitchhack, but an Estonian guy took me all the way to Norway's coast!
Quite fast speeds (60kmh) but otherwise good spot.
Plenty of room to pull over and plenty of cars but seems to be mostly going to just Jyväskylä.

Wantes to go towards Jyväskylä so had a sign saying "4" but didn't seem to work too well. Eventually someone took me to the highway ramp where I walked to the right road. Not too many cars but probably okay for Kuopio direction.
Good spot but most people seem to go to just Heinola. After the 4th car heading there, I decided take it.
Towards north, decent amount of traffic, got a car here immediately, however spot seemed uncomfortable for drivers, so wouldn't recommend it fully, wait time more likely of 30+ minutes otherwise
An alternative to the Shell, seemed better to my eyes, as well as better plowed during winter. Cars go slow here but didn't get a ride within 30 or so minutes so just walked further north

I was told by the locals that this bus stop is apparently good for going north, but i'd argue against that, after waiting for 30+ minutes i just started walking along the road, about 700 meters or so onwards there is a nice straight stretch with no side roads or anything to make visibility very good with quite decent shoulders, i'd recommend walking there
Nice bus stop for north direction, has a roof and seat as well since not that much traffic around here, wait times of 20-40 minutes
Towards Kalajoki, fine bus stop with wide  shoulder, but wait times of 20-50 minutes expected, not that much traffic also
Yet another poor looking bus stop that got a ride within 20-30 minutes, little traffic for an E-road, a lot of cars will turn left just after this bus stop so be aware of that
Decent spot for going north, low speeds on cars coming to the highway, u can hitch both, but not that much space for cars from already on the highway to stop, wait time of 30-40 minutes
Towards the islands, seems like a great spot and lots of traffic but still took 40-60 minutes to get a ride further
Towards Rauma, pretty fine spot, good visibility for cars, but the bus stop itself is kinda small, wait times of 15-45 minutes
Not that much used entrance to go towards Rauma, wait time of 20-50 minutes, you can also go to ABC and ask around
Okayish bus stop towards east, decent traffic but wait times of 30-50 minutes
Towards Förby, seems decent road for hitching, but little traffic, especially in the evenings, Finby has street lights which makes it better, wait times of 30-50 minutes
Towards Turku, not that commonly used entrance, but nice area for cars to stop, wait time of 30-40 minutes
Small bus stop towards Turku, seems uncomfy for cars to stop but still found a car within 30 minutes, decent amount of traffic but the speeds may be quite fast
Very little traffic either direction, but first-second car will pick you up, wait time of 10-40 minutes
Really low traffic but still managed to get a ride to Li
At the exit of the national park. Cars go fast

A wise man once said these words about hitchhiking which have been ringing in my head ever since: "It is not popular in Finland."

Anyways, it's technically a nice spot with loads of space for cars to pull over, many of which turn west onto the highway. Maybe you'll have more luck than we did.
We were very lucky at this spot. There was only one car at the gas station, and they brought us directly to Turku.

Most cars seem to go to Helsinki, so if you want to go west, it's not perfect. But people were very friendly and smiled at us at least :-) And if you want to go to Helsinki, this spot is probably really nice.
Cars going on pretty high speed. Tried to get a ride to Espoo, managed to get to Tuusula where there was much better spot.
A lot of traffic heading both ways, got a ride to Helsinki with a sign and thumb. Took relatively long considering the amount of traffic.
Nice spot to hitchhike further south (towards Vaasa), kind of low traffic after 8PM
Wide rest stop somewhere hear, direction south. High speeds and low traffic but otherwise ok.
Not too much room to stop but still okay. Low traffic in the evening. Direction Kittilä/Rovaniemi.
High speeds (100km/h) but good visibility and a short bus stop for people to stop. Not ideal though.
Towards north. Decent spot, just about enough traffic and slow speeds. Also enough space for people to stop.
Not too much traffic but still a pretty decent spot. Slow speeds and some shoulder for the cars. Direction north. Also good place to wild camp across the big highway.
High speeds but good visibility and a bus stop for the cars to stop. Heading south but works both ways.
Fast speeds but there's a bus stop for the cars to stop to. Not the best spot but gets the job done. Heading south.
heading north, a cool priest took us to Karesuando. not many cars, but a good spot
hitched on a work day, pretty empty roads, headed to Kilpisjarvi, maybe the road on Swedish-Finnish border would´ve been better. Anyway spot is ok (near bus stop) just the roads are empty
good spot, if you go to kilpisjarvi, and it´s two of you, you can split and hicth on two different roads
heading towards Kilpisjarvi.
A decent spot; our waiting time was longer mostly due to very, very low traffic in the early morning (6:00-7:30).
Bustop heading south. Not the best spot, cars go 100km and come behind a corner. They barely have enough time to see you and stop. Better than nothing.
Hitchhiked in the snow at some bus stop here. After 20 minutes I got a ride to Sodankylä.
Got a ride to Tana Bru from here somewhere on this road
Hitchhiked from here to Helsinki. Took some time, but I managed to get there.
Hitched here 1-2 h on Tuesday morning - no result. Tried to Lappenranta direction.

There isn't really enough space to stand by the ramp, but if you walk some 100 meters south towards the city on Kemintie road, there's just enough space for cars to stop. Can't really recommend this place though.

Waited here for 60 minutes around noon on a workday and only found a very short ride (15 km or so) with a delivery driver. Very few people go onto the highway from here.
I'd recommend going straight to Ii with the bus (zones A-C) and hitchhiking from there.
very few people going to the north
good place, maybe its better to go right to conectin on the higway. You are still before higway sign and you also can catch car from oposit direction

Hitchhiking spot for north of Oulu to A4/E75. A bus stop with plenty of space for stopping just before entrance to the highway. 

The downsides of this location are the distance from city center and the fact that not that many people may be driving far to north from here.
It is a good spot to head north. I got a lift almost to Kemijarvi
We (2 females) waited for quite a while heading north considering the relatively busy road. A car pulled down after 1,5--2hours because he had seen us hitchhiking in Kuusamo the previous evening.
Stood after the highway sign where there’s space to stop, police showed up and kicked me out fast. I’d try another spot if going to Turku.
hardly any space for cars to stop here.  if you walk 100 m onto the highway, behind th curve,there is more space. it's not legal but police passed me twice without stopping
I got a direct ride to TURKU after 20 minutes, nice place! :) Just take care of the incoming traffic!
bus stop is definitely better, at least it's less dangerous than the ramp. but try to catch the car from the place near the gas station, it's better.
to Turku: on-ramp, use a sign. if this doesn't work out, try a bus stop on Huopalahdentie.

You should not stay here
There is a turn just after that, where comes and goes nearly half of the cars
So just walk 200m to the bus stop after the turn
Not much traffic and I ended up stranded here and had to get back to lahti

Small rest stop on route 4. Not the most convenient to reach by foot (take a bus to "Mäkeläntie"[don't trust the timetables on google maps!!], then walk for about 45mins on the street until you reach a bridge, then there's a path in the forest and a door in the fence right in front of stop'n go grill). 
i waited there for about 90mins, but the sun was already going down so not a lot of traffic. in the end, got a lift all the way to jyväskylä.
