Spot looked good, but noone stopped within 180 or so minutes so I ended up taking a bus to Ii, which I'd recommend to do always here, very few people use this exit, during winter the road conditions get pretty bad also.
Very good spot, high traffic but it's better to write nearest city than Rovaniemi or North.
I really dont know why, but even with a lot of traffic around noone pass by here. Better to walk 25 minutes to the other spot south.
Only a little traffic on saturday morning. Not the best place in Rovaniemi.
Didn't get a ride, got a tip from a passerby to move to a spot after Shell. Only 500 m walking to that spot
I was here on a Monday around noon. It really is not a lot of traffic going here but lots of space to pull over. I got rather lucky and got a ride to kemi within 20 minutes (female, summer, daytime)

Bus stop on slip road in direction of Kemi, Oulu, etc. Seems a good spot, but I was there on Saturday afternoon and not many cars were passing. Waited 30min and tried another spot further along the road.
Cars are going 80km/h or 100km/h so not the best place
Going South, a bus stop opposite Kilpishalli/KMarket - enough space to stop, the cars go slowly. You might need time to get your ride, but be patient. (July 2023).
Stayed here more than 2h heading South, but nothing, this place is unhitchikable!

good spot. not so many cars. Wanted to reach kilpisjarvi that day, but had to sleep in Laavu cause after 11PM despite the ling days, 0 cars on the road. anyway, got a ride till the crossroad to Enontkio
Stayed here 2h30 heading to Kilpisjärvi but no way!
don't stay here. go 3 more stops to "kalannintie" with any of the buses that stop here for a much better location.
It took 2 hours but i don't think there is a better way, maybe that was though luck.
a bus stop
Seemed a good location, but possibly not perfect visibility for drivers. Got lift to Silinjärvi after 1h20m.
Valkeinen L bus stop in direction of Oulu. Average 1 car every 2 minutes. Perfect place to stop but speed limit is 100kmh and traffic must be mostly local...

There is a construction site here that slows cars down to 50 km/h. (auagust 2016) still not advisable to get dropped off here by people taking the exit to Nummela. Waited several hours and people in the village are super afraid of travelers (refused to give me tab water etc)

Place is perfect. But don't even think about going from here to Kuusamo on 81 road. It might look moderately busy but most of the traffic is local. 

I got few lifts further east, few kms each. (and waiting time around 1h) Between of Kuusamo and Rovaniemi there is almost no traffic during a day + it is literally dead from evening till morning.

I was here for like 5h or 6hours on a weekend and noone stopped or went to the South I think on weekdays is good becasue I got picked up the other day 
Eventually a German guy invited me home to his flatmates so it was cool but I would reccommend going to at least Rovaniemi if you're crossing here :)
Not a good place, very few cars entering on the highway, better try the spot on the opposite side of the bridge

The bus stop, both directions. Stayed here for 3 hours with a sigh "Kotka" at the day time in november, 2014. Perhaps, the place on the opposite side of Loviisa city is much more better for the east direction
We (2 female hitchers) waited here about 3 hours without anyone stopping. Road certainly wasnt busy but still quite a few cars between 7-10pm. Our bad luck could have been because of the late timing.

Low amount of traffic here, took me quite long to get a lift onwards after I was dropped off here. I guess most of the cars heading North use the next motorway ramp. But fairly good amount of space for cars to stop here.
Prefered to change a position after 25 mins
Was directed to Rus-Fin boarder. Stopped a couple of cars but they was loaded. Strage people lol. Dont go in this area w/o a car.
There's no shoulder on the road. Get a bit further and ull find it. Nobody almost stop here, thanks to truckers
this place is quite desert, nobody stop here during winter time
car are going too fast
no space for the car to stop nor for us waiting on the border of the road
we were lifting to lappeenranta, very bad spot, because all trafic to LPPNRNT goes by left side of the road
Bad spot, for example to Kouvola/ Lappeenranta, but mayby is not bad to Mikkeli
Bus stop. Stayed more than one hour heading to Turku, but no one stopped. From here it's better to walk the 5 km until the main road number 9.
Bus stop. Be sure to NOT end up in this desert! We were quite lucky though and we find a ride to Muonio after 40 min...
Bus stop. Not a really good spot, little space to stop, local traffic. Got only a very short ride.
First bus stop after the motorway and the road 58 ramp, but cars are too fast or accelerating from the exit ramp, waited 1 hour but no one stopped. Next bus stop is so much better.
Bus stop. Cars run very fast in this point... Found only a short ride to Lappi after a while.
Bus stop. Local traffic here
But I fucking wait 4 hours. Raaaaaaah !!!
Nice place, just before the Highway. Drivers comes slowly because a radar, and they can park all along the street.
Direction South: No traffic
E63/9/23 east- and southwards; you can first try here and if it doesn't work out, walk further down the road.
East- and southwards: This is a second option to start from.

Tried to hitchhike with Viking Line car passengers, offering them to pay the difference to take us with them in their car, which is still cheaper than the cheapest ticket. It was the darker time of the year and the people where unfriendly and suspicious. Furthermore, there were only a few cars (morning departure).
To Lahti and Porvoo. This place was under construction/repair in may 2008. Place was only average before.

To the South, a bus stop. Use a sign.

Need a better place, help anyone?

Traffic, but nobody was willing to pick me up.
Had to walk to the center of Tampere.
I took a shorter ride to a nearby village. Cars are going fast and are not willing to stop. I would advise going from the south to get off at the Pihtipudas gas station.
One of the longest waits in my hitchhiking live
Not a great spot for going south, not a lot of drivers here and the location isn't great either. The ABC south of the city works much better

Seemed okay spot, but didnt get many cars, after some time (around 5pm cars start to drive out from nearby workplaces to go south so gets hard to use around that time, all-in-all pretty poor spot, wait times of 60+ minutes for sure
Barely any traffic, towards E8, good visibility but high speeds, waiting time of 40-50 minutes
About here seems to have first "villagers" that seem friendly to pick you up to the swedish villages towards Pensala
Around here finally got a car, but all-in-all it was a really difficult road to hitchhike, I'd avoid unless u have to come here
Possible spot to talk with some people by the info table, but most of them are headed to west, otherwise useless spot, cars wont stop from road to here
Very poor spot towards Rauma, speeds are fast, people tend to ignore, wait time of 100+ minutes
Towards east, wait times of 60+ minutes, not really a good spot for stopping, people might be unfriendly

First okayish spot since Tammisaari for north direction, not that much traffic as well as hilly road with nowhere safe to spot, try to stay here by the entrance of the road so that cars could pull up to the bus stop after this, wait times of 40-60 minutes
Seems fine spot towards Perniö but yet again nobody stopped forever, wait times of 40-80 minutes
First spot for a car to stop after a long time, try to get a car for a longer distance as there's not gonna be many safe and good spots coming if headed to north

First kinda okayish spot, but the lightposts get on the way unless you dare to be in the middle of the road, very small bus stop, very poor area in general if direction is towards Perniö, I just started to walk along the road after 60 or so minutes

Another in theory good spot, but in reality a spot where you'll wait for a ride towards Kisko for 60+ minutes, wide bus stop with speeding lane for cars coming from Perniön as. road, high speeds for cars already on Kiskontie
Nice long part of the road, probably the first decent spot since Finby center, little traffic, wait times of 40-60 minutes

Another awful spot towards Kisko, not that much traffic, tried both- the bus stop just a bit after (but with very little space) and this area after the turn, whilst speeds were slow noone seemed to stop, wait time of 60-120 minutes
Around here the road widens for bus stop, still quite a bad spot but by the evening I did manage to catch a ride with total time of 2+ hours alongside the road for going south from Salo
In theory good spot but in reality nobody stops, decent traffic flow for south direction, but had absolutely no luck and just started walking along the road

Okayish bus stop towards Turku, there's a restaurant the other side of the road where lots of longer distance vans etc stop by, on this side just a mere bus stop, which is a bit uncomfy as there's gonna be another lane after this for cars turning right, wait time of 40-60 minutes

Not a great spot for getting to Helsinki. Waited close to two hours without anyone stopping, and another hitchhiker that I met said they waited there for 3 hours! Most people do not turn onto the highway from here and most of the cars had a whole family inside anyway. Would recommend waiting at the bus stop along the highway slightly north.

Not the worst place, it can work sometimes i guess. We were There around 5 pm on weekday, so it was very calm and hardly few cars went through. From here, you can take bus straight to Turku for 19 e/person. It leaves every 18.00,19, 20,... Maybe more frequented in the morning. You will be in Turku in 1,5 Hour.
Dead at night. Almost dead during the day. I managed finally to get to Kuusamo, but it wasn't easy.
As far as I remember, not very convenient place for cars to stop, so better follow the advice upwards.
I was waiting here 6 hours :( that's bad place! better if you hitchhike "more up" (where is motorway starts)
Bus stop, but bad visibility. Don't even try to stop cars running at 120 km/h... if you unluckily you're here trying to reach Jyväskylä it's better to walk 8 km until road 9!
Local traffic only
Make sure you don't get dropped in this desert...

We waited here for four plus hours, starting at 4 pm. A lot of cars passed in the direction of Turku but no one stopped. We had a sign that said “Turku, suunta”
The spot itself seemed like a good one. A local dropped us off there and claimed that all Helsinki going to Turku would pass there. I don’t think that was true, but either way it was a safe spot for cars to stop, they’d see us and have a very long stroke to drive on and brake. A lot of cars (and busses) would stop to drop ppl off/ pick

Horrible stretch of road for going north, walked along the road and even though it was good visibility and not that much traffic, noone stopped for ages, wait times of 120+ minutes, around here I finally got a car

Tried all three of the bus stops coming from Oravais, this here looking like the best one, but honestly no point waiting in them, just walk along the road, little traffic and wait times of 100+ minutes

Which seemed like an okay spot, turned out to be almost impossible to get a car towards east, wait times of 120+ minutes, just start walking and have a thumb up, no point in waiting anywhere around here, even the local cars coming from the villages don't pick up

Tried both bus stops, stayed here longer, but nobody still picked up within 120+ minutes towards Ekenäs/Tammisaari, awful road, people seemed rude, by the end just gave up and started walking by the road and finally like 20 minutes later got picked up
Towards north, avoid this spot, nowhere near a safe place for cars to stop, if you end up here just start walking, I'll mark the first semi-decent spot

The old road towards Turku, but no use of hitching here, most cars go to the next villages, even tho the spot is decent the cars seem to avoid you, just get to highway entrance, wait time of 100+ minutes expected

Centre of Hanhisuo (a small village) is very curvy road, barely any traffic and for some reason the cars that did pass weren't keen to pick you up, just kept walking, wait time of a hour at least is expected
As expected this road is not used, walked all the length of this forestroad to Hanhisuo
Not a spot for hichhiking but a good place to camp if stranded, even a compost toilet close ;)

No one stopped as there was a fog in the evening during heavy rain. Cars drive too fast, but there was a space for car to stop. Cars passing us even 4 meters in the opposite direction on the road. People ignored us and just drove around.
Pretty wide road but drivers were afraid as there isn't official space to stop the car. (It's better to walk to the bus stop Murtola, which is few kilometers more to the north.)
High traffic, but cars drive too fast to stop.
High traffic but cars drove too fast that they couldn't stop at all.
